Home Sport Football Real Madrid CF Sport Marcelo responds to suggestions he wants to quit Real Madrid and join Cristiano Ronaldo at Juventus The Real Madrid full-back was close friends with Ronaldo and there were suggestions he could be used in a swap deal This is a modal window. Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window. End of dialog window. This is a modal window. This modal can be closed by pressing the Escape key or activating the close button. This is a modal window. This modal can be closed by pressing the Escape key or activating the close button.  Marcelo has rubbished the rumours that he wants to join  Cristiano Ronaldo  at Juventus.   The Brazilian had a close relationship with Ronaldo during their time together at  Real Madrid. Ronaldo left the Bernabeu after 11 years this summer, opting for a move to Juve in an £80million switch. It had been suggested that Marcelo could have been used in a swap deal for Alex Sandro, which would reunite him with his pal in Serie A. But Marcelo has now moved to quash those rumours, claiming that he wants to end his career at Real.  “I’ve heard so many stupid things, I’m here until the end,” Marcelo told  Real Madrid  TV.  Repeat video Play Next video Full screen Mute “Some people become opinion leaders and create things that don’t exist. I’ve seen and read a lot of nonsense. “I’m as fired-up as Vinicius, who is 18, I’ll stay here until the end of my career.” Vinicius, meanwhile, could leave Real in January to head back to childhood club Flamengo on loan. The fact Vinicius has gone from playing in front of 80,000 fans at the Maracana in Brazil to featuring in front of barely 1,000 in the Spanish lower tiers, as he is currently playing for the Castilla side, has worried Real bosses.  According to  Marca,  they are now considering sending Vinicius back to Flamengo in January, as they feel playing top flight football in front of monster crowds would be more beneficial for his development.
